intro: Lactuca contracta, commonly known as the curled lettuce or Italian lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is characterized by its tightly curled leaves that resemble a compact head, giving it its common name. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are often used in culinary applications, particularly in Mediterranean cuisine.
